intro: Lavoisiera senae, commonly known as the Sena's lavoisiera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to habitat loss, Lavoisiera senae is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
